intro: Euphorbia schinzii subsp. bechuanica, commonly known as the Bechuanian spurge, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, fleshy stems and leaves, which are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Due to its slow growth and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
